heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 283.2m lower than yesterday, 30.2m higher than the past week, 146.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 789m and a peak of 2540m, averaging 1188.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
